content.question:
<math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table with 5 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x.” The heading for row 2 is “f of x.” The data are as follows. Column 1. x is 1. f of x is 2. Column 2. x is 2. f of x is 3. Column 3. x is 3. f of x is 5. Column 4. x is 4. f of x is 6. Column 5. x is 5. f of x is 14." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em " equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>14</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
Selected values of a function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are shown in the table above. What is the average rate of change of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> over the interval <math alttext="open bracket, 1 comma 5, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 5 minus 1, and denominator 14 minus 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>14</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 14 plus 2, and denominator 5 plus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>14</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 14 minus 2, and denominator 5 minus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>14</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2 plus 3, plus 5, plus 6, plus 14, and denominator 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>14</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 14 minus 2, and denominator 5 minus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>14</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
